parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name or affiliation.  It discusses the importance of maintaining Romania's pro-European trajectory, a general political issue, not a specific candidate's platform.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a public Facebook post paid for by Mediashare, and its content addresses a broad audience concerned with Romania's political direction. The reach data in the post metadata confirms this wide dissemination.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post mentions the importance of the December 2024 decisions, it does not explicitly advocate for or against any particular candidate or party. The objective seems to be to encourage a pro-European stance from the political environment, not to influence votes for specific candidates.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information in a journalistic style, citing a letter from business organizations and reporting on their concerns. It does not overtly promote a particular candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; it reports on the views of several business organizations.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2325791844453782</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Mediashare, discusses the importance of maintaining Romania's pro-European trajectory.  While the post mentions the upcoming December 2024 decisions, it does not endorse or oppose any specific candidate or party. The content is presented in a journalistic style, reporting on a letter from business organizations.  The broad reach of the paid post targets a wide audience, but the lack of specific candidate endorsements and the journalistic nature of the content suggest it does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t).  The post's objective appears to be to influence the general political climate, not to sway votes for particular candidates.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Mediashare</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
